page.title: 03The Delaval Curse.
page.content: The{curse}said that while the Delavals owned both the estates of Ford and Delaval, no male Delaval would die peacefully in his bed. The first to be affected by the curse was Francis himself. In 1759 he fell down some steps at Delaval Hall, and died. His eldest son, Francis, died in Delaval Hall after a wild bout of eating and drinking. Of the later male Delavals, Thomas fell from a horse, Robert and Henry died in a battle overseas, George was drowned at sea and Ralph was killed in an earthquake in Lisbon. In 1814, Edward Delaval survived the curse and died peacefully in his bed, by which time, the estate at Ford had passed from the Delaval family! We found some of this information on a trip to Northumberland County Archive (see page 4).
